name: Cherry Tabbouleh
description: Like authentic tabbouleh, this is primarily an herb salad with a little bit of bulgur and the wonderful juicy surprise of cherries in each bite.
recipeCategory: dinner, easy, lunch, quick, salads and dressings
keywords: bulgur, cherries, pistachio, main course, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 1/4 cups finely chopped parsley, tightly packed
1/4 to ½ cup finely chopped mint, to taste, tightly packed
24 sweet cherries, such as Bing or Queen Anne, pitted and diced
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, more to taste
1/4 cup pistachios, lightly toasted and coarsely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Place bulgur in a bowl. Add a little salt, cover with boiling water and let sit for 20 to 30 minutes, until bulgur is tender and has absorbed most of the water.
Transfer bulgur to a strainer and press out excess water.
Combine the bulgur, parsley, mint and cherries in a large bowl and toss.
In a separate bowl, whisk together lemon juice, salt to taste, the olive oil and the pistachio oil. Toss with salad mixture. Add pistachios, toss again and serve.
